title: InDesign book
content: Which is your favourite InDesign tutorials book?
author: sebsan

comments.content:
[Real World InDesign CS](http://web.archive.org/web/20131104020929/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/032121921X/ref=pd_sim_1/002-2299043-6754462?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance) by Blatner and Kvern -- very comprehensive, good for more advanced topics. Looks like the [update for CS2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131104020929/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0321322029/ref=pd_sim_3/002-2299043-6754462?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance) is due to hit the shelves in December.

For looking up basic stuff, I use the [Visual Quickstart Series for InDesign CS](http://web.archive.org/web/20131104020929/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0321213483/ref=pd_sim_4/002-2299043-6754462?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance). I'm also interested in getting [Adobe InDesign CS/CS2 Breakthroughs](http://web.archive.org/web/20131104020929/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0321334132/ref=wl_it_dp/002-2299043-6754462?%5Fencoding=UTF8&coliid=I3POBABQD2RZOL&v=glance&colid=3HNIFP5RGYVYN) by Blatner.
I'll second the vote for RWIDCS. Fantastic—haven't needed anything else.
